title: Welcome to the e-version of अष्टाङ्गहृदयम्

intro.para: अष्टाङ्गहृदय is an important text of Ayurveda, one of the ancient systems of medicine in India. Written by Acharya Vagbhata, it is a concise compilation of medical knowledge, drawing from the earlier classical texts like the Charaka Samhita and Sushruta Samhita

The Ashtanga Hrudaya is divided into sutras (verses) and provides comprehensive guidance on various aspects of health, disease prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and lifestyle. Its name, which translates to 'Heart of the Eight Branches', refers to the eight components of Ayurveda: internal medicine, surgery, psychiatry, toxicology, rejuvenation, aphrodisiacs, pediatrics, and ENT treatments. It remains a core text for Ayurvedic practitioners today
